page.title: 08An old person from Shedfield
page.content: We have interviewed 78 year old Commander Richard Phillimore whose family have been associated with Shedfield since 1866. In 1866 his grandfather moved to Shedfield House where he lived with his wife and 7 children.His grand - father, a Naval Admiral,farmed about 200 acres, most of which is now a golf course. As a young boy he remembers the main roads in the area just being dusty tracks. Shedfield House dates back to the C17th but there is archeological evidence to show that the site was occupied before this. Ditches have been discovered containing large amounts of pottery, some unique to Britain, and a large Roman roof tile. The Commander is still a very active member of the community and continues to teach at Sunday School.
